tit.cmt: タイトルのため、括弧内の補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 和名類聚抄（わみょうるいじゅしょう）は、平安時代中期に作られた辞書である。
sen.e: Wamyo Ruijusho is a dictionary compiled in the middle era of the Heian period.
Wamyo Ruijusho is a dictionary compiled in the middle era of the Heian period.
Wamyo Ruijusho is a dictionary compiled in the mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: mid Heian period として表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 承平 (日本)年間 (931年 - 938年)、勤子内親王の求めに応じて源順（みなもとのしたごう）が編纂した。
sen.e: In Shohei era (in Japan) (931 - 938), MINAMOTO no Shitago compiled it at a request of Imperial Princess Isoko.
In the Shohei era (in Japan) (931 - 938), MINAMOTO no Shitago compiled it at a request of Imperial Princess Isoko.
In the Johei era (in Japan) (931 - 938), MINAMOTO no Shitago compiled it at a request of Imperial Princess Isoko.

sen.j: 中国の分類辞典『爾雅』の影響を受けている。
sen.e: It was affected by Jiga (Erya), a classification dictionary in China.
It was influenced by Jiga (Erya), a classification dictionary in China.
It was influenced by "Jiga" (Erya), a classification dictionary in China.

sen.j: 名詞をまず漢語で類聚し、意味により分類して項目立て、万葉仮名で日本語に対応する名詞の読み（和名・倭名）をつけた上で、漢籍（字書・韻書・博物書）を出典として多数引用しながら説明を加える体裁をとる。
sen.e: It was made in the following style: First, nouns were collected in Chinese, were grouped based on their meanings, an item name was given to each group of nouns, a Japanese pronunciation (called women: literally a Japanese name) of each of these nouns was given using Manyo-gana (a form of syllabary used in the Manyo-shu or Collection of Myriad Leaves), and to each noun, explanations were given by citing its Chinese document sources (dictionaries, Chinese dictionaries arranged by the final sound of each word, and encyclopedia).

It was made in the following style: First, nouns were collected in Chinese, were grouped based on their meanings, an item name was given to each group of nouns, a Japanese pronunciation (called women: literally a Japanese name) of each of these nouns was given using Manyo-gana (a form of syllabary used in the Manyo-shu or Collection of Myriad Leaves), and to each noun, explanations were given by citing its Chinese document sources (dictionaries, Chinese dictionaries arranged by the final sound of each word, and encyclopedia).

It was made in the following style: First, nouns were collected in Chinese, were grouped based on their meanings, an item name was given to each group of nouns, a Japanese pronunciation (called "wamyo," literally a Japanese name) of each of these nouns was given using Manyo-gana (a form of syllabary used in the Manyo-shu [Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves]), and to each noun, explanations were given by citing its Chinese document sources (dictionaries, Chinese dictionaries arranged by the final sound of each word, and encyclopedia).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 今日の国語辞典の他、漢和辞典や百科事典の要素を多分に含んでいるのが特徴。
sen.e: It is not only provided with factors of a Japanese language dictionary in the present day, but also provided with those of a Chinese-to-Japanese dictionary and of an encyclopedia, constituting its rare feature.

It is not only provided with factors of a Japanese language dictionary in the present day, but also provided with those of a Chinese-to-Japanese dictionary and of an encyclopedia, constituting its rare feature.

It is not only provided with factors of a Japanese language dictionary in the present day, but also provided with those of a Chinese-to-Japanese dictionary and of an encyclopedia, constituting its rare feature.

sen.j: 当時から漢語の和訓を知るために重宝された。
sen.e: Since having been compiled, this document was used frequently for knowing Japanese pronunciations for Chinese words

sen.j: 江戸時代の国学発生以降、平安時代以前の語彙・語音を知る資料として、また社会・風俗・制度などを知る史料として国文学・日本語学・日本史の世界で重要視されている書物である。
sen.e: Since the time when the study of Japanese classical literatures started in the Edo period, it has been highly evaluated as a document where information about vocabulary and about pronunciations of words is available, and in addition, it has also been highly evaluated in the fields of Japanese literatures, of Japanese language study and of Japanese history, as a document in which information about states of society, customs and social systems is available.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 和名類聚抄は「倭名類聚鈔」「倭名類聚抄」とも書かれ、その表記は写本によって一定してしない。

sen.j: 巻数は十巻または二十巻である。
sen.e: There are Wamyosho consisted of ten volumes and Wamyosho consisted of twenty volumes.

sen.j: その内容に大きく異同があるため「十巻本」「二十巻本」として区別され、それぞれの系統の写本が存在する。
sen.e: Because their contents are largely different with each other, each of them is called a 10-volume book or a 20-volume for differentiation, and copies of each book remain.

sen.j: 狩谷エキ斎は、十巻本を底本としている。
sen.e: Ekisai KARIYA positions the 10-volume book as the standard.
Ekisai KARIYA positions the 10-volume book as the standard.
Ekisai KARIYA positions the 10-volume book as the standard.

sen.j: また、国語学者の亀田次郎は、二十巻本は後人が増補したものとしている。
sen.e: Jiro KAMEDA, a Japanese language scholar, says that the 20-volume book was augmented by later people.
Jiro KAMEDA, a Japanese language scholar, says that the 20-volume book was augmented by later people.
Jiro KAMEDA, a Japanese language scholar, says that the 20-volume book was augmented by later people.

sen.j: なお二十巻本は古代律令制における行政区画である国・郡・郷の名称を網羅しており、この点でも基本史料となっている。
sen.e: The 20-volume book covers the names of 国 (provinces), 郡 (counties), and 郷 (villages), which constituted area units for administrative control in the ancient ritsu-ryo code-based system, constituting a basic historical document even in this aspect.

The 20-volume book covers the names of 国 (provinces), 郡 (counties), and 郷 (villages), which constituted area units for administrative control in the ancient ritsu-ryo code-based system, constituting a basic historical document even in this aspect.

The 20-volume book covers the names of provinces, counties and villages, which constituted area units for administrative control in the ancient ritsuryo code-based system, constituting a basic historical document even in this aspect.
sen.cmt: 漢字の表記は不要と考え、削除しました。

sen.j: ［例］ 大和国葛下郡神戸郷・山直郷・高額郷・加美郷・蓼田郷・品治（保無智）郷・當麻（多以末）郷
sen.e: Examples: Kanbe-go (village), Yamadai-go,Takagaku-go, Kami-go, tadeda-go, Homuchi (品治r or 保無智 in Chinese characters)-go, and Taima (當麻 or 多以末 in Chinese characters)-go, in katsuge-gun (county) of the Yamato province

sen.j: 十巻本
sen.e: The 10-volume books
The 10-volume books
The 10-volume books

sen.j: 現在、十巻本の本文として最も流布しているのは、狩谷エキ斎校注の『箋注倭名類聚抄』である。
sen.e: Today, the most widely used text of the 10-volume book is "Senchuwamyoruijusho" revised and annotated by Ekisai KARIYA.
Today, the most widely used text of the 10-volume book is "Senchuwamyoruijusho" revised and annotated by Ekisai KARIYA.
Today, the most widely used text of the 10-volume book is "Senchu wamyo ruijusho" revised and annotated by Ekisai KARIYA.
sen.cmt: Senchu wamyo ruijusho とスペースを入れました。

sen.j: ただし『箋注倭名類聚抄』は下にも書く通り明治時代刊なので、それまでは写本による流布が主であった。
sen.e: However, "Senchuwamyoruijusho" was published in the Meiji period as described below, and until then, its manuscripts are mostly available.
However, "Senchuwamyoruijusho" was published in the Meiji period as described below, and until then, its manuscripts are mostly available.
However, "Senchu wamyo ruijusho" was published in the Meiji period as described below, and until then, its manuscripts were mostly available.

sen.j: なお十巻本の写本の中でも「下総本」とそれに連なる系統の本は、他の本と異なる記述を持つなど異質の本である。
sen.e: Of the 10-volume manuscripts, "Shimosa book" is unique because the contents of it and of the books related to it are quite different from those of other 10-volume books.
Of the 10-volume manuscripts, "Shimosa book" is unique because the contents of it and of the books related to it are quite different from those of other 10-volume books.
Of the 10-volume manuscripts, 'Shimosa book' is unique because the contents of it and of the books related to it are quite different from those of other 10-volume books.

sen.j: このため十巻本の写本には、しばしば下総本系の本を参照し、朱でその校異を書き入れているものも少なくない。
sen.e: Therefore, in not a few 10-volume book manuscripts, Shimosa book-related manuscripts are often referred to and corrections are written in red ink.
Therefore, in not a few 10-volume book manuscripts, Shimosa book-related manuscripts are often referred to and corrections are written in red ink.
Therefore, in not a few 10-volume book manuscripts, Shimosa book-related manuscripts are often referred to and corrections are written in red ink.

sen.j: しかし狩谷はこの下総本の本文を「後世の改竄によるもの」と見なし、「諸本の中で最も劣悪」として認めていない。
sen.e: However, KARIYA considered the Shimosa book that the text of Shimosa books was not original, including altered portions, and rejects it as "the most inferior one of the various books concerned."
However, KARIYA considered the Shimosa book that the text of Shimosa books was not original, including altered portions, and rejects it as "the most inferior one of the various books concerned."
However, KARIYA considered the Shimosa book as 'falsification by the posterity,' and rejects it as 'the most inferior one of the various books concerned.'

sen.j: 現在、二十巻本の本文として最も流布しているのは、那波道円校注の「元和古活字本」である。
sen.e: Today, "Genna kokatsujibon" (literally, books printed using old types in the Genna era (1615 - 1624)) are used most widely as the text of the 20-volume books.

sen.j: ただし「元和古活字本」は稀覯書で、昭和7年（1932年）に影印復刻されるまではほとんど世に出回らなかった。
sen.e: However, "Genna kokatsujibon" was a rare book and was scarcely available in the market until its photo-copy version was published.,

sen.e: However, "Genna kokatsujibon" was a rare book and was scarcely available in the market until its photo-copy version was published.
However, 'Genna kokatsuji-bon' was a rare book and was scarcely available in the market until its photo-copy version was published in 1932.

sen.j: そのため、代わりに「慶安版本」「寛文版本」が広く用いられ、明治時代初期まで何度も刷を重ねた。
sen.e: Therefore, "Keian printed books" (books printed in the Keian era (1648-1652)) and "Kanbun printed books" (books printed in the Kanbun era (1661-1673)) were widely used instead, being published many times until early Meiji era.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, "Keian printed books" (books printed in the Keian era (1648-1652)) and "Kanbun printed books" (books printed in the Kanbun era (1661-1673)) were widely used instead, being published many times until the early Meiji era.

Therefore, 'Keian printed books' (books printed in the Keian era [1648-1652]) and 'Kanbun printed books' (books printed in the Kanbun era [1661-1673]) were widely used instead, being published many times until the early Meiji period.
sen.cmt: era period としました。"→ ' としました。

sen.j: また写本のうち「高山寺本」は、「国郡部」の後に古代律令制下の駅（うまや）を記してある。
sen.e: Of the manuscripts concerned, the "Kozan-ji Temple book" includes descriptions of the names of inn-concentrated places along roads in the ancient ritsuryo code-based system, after those of the "province/county category."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Of the manuscripts concerned, the "Kozan-ji Temple book" includes descriptions of the names of inn-concentrated places along roads in the ancient ritsuryo code-based system, after those of the "province/county category."

Of the manuscripts concerned, the 'Kozan-ji Temple book' includes descriptions of the names of inn-concentrated places along roads in the ancient ritsuryo code-based system, after those of the 'province/county category.'

sen.j: 他の二十巻本には見られない独自の本文を持つほか、本文の異同も多い。
sen.e: In addition to including its own unique text that is not found in other 20-volume books, this book also includes many descriptions different from those of others.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition to including its own unique text that is not found in other 20-volume books, this book also includes many descriptions different from those of others.
In addition to including its own unique text that is not found in other 20-volume books, this book also includes many descriptions different from those of others.

sen.j: そのため、特に「国郡部」を見る際に「元和古活字本」とともに参照される。
sen.e: Therefore, this books is used together with "Genna kokatsujibon," especially when referring to "province/county category."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, this book is used together with "Genna kokatsujibon," especially when referring to the "province/county category."
